body:
I've implemented a default answer for Optional. The code uses reflection so it should still compile and run cleanly on Java versions below 8.

However, I have absolutely no idea how to test this code, because it would require two different JDKs to test both branches.

issue.title: Added a default answer for java.util.Optional

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
I've introduced a new default answer for `java.util.Optional` that returns an empty optional.

The code uses reflection, so it should compile and run cleanly in older versions than Java 8.

---

**EDIT by mockito team** : fixes #191

body: Hey all, what's the status on this? We're porting quite a big codebase to Java 8 currently and it's quite a PITA to have to define behavior to mock all methods returning `Optional` now. Is there an ETA for when this will be available in a release?
I've submitted the fix #192 more than a year ago... üòû

I will try to look at some of the outstanding issues until the end of July. Sorry, I am really busy with Java 9 adoption in Byte Buddy since the last half year, there is a lot to do but this is still happening, no worries.

I just merged your PR on my machine and rebased it to the current state. I also wrote the missing unit test to validate this. I am currently traveling and the local Wifi does not open a port for SSH. I'll push to master tonight and trigger a new build.
Great! Thanks a lot. Shall I write some more for Iterable and Stream?
Yes, please. I will try to get them out in short time, this basic Java 8 support is really about time to be added.
Will do once you have merged the first PR. üëç
Wow, guys. You rock! ü§ò. What's the story with the version numbers? There are a lot of 2.0 betas on Maven central already? Are these preview versions for 3.0?
@olivergierke these are 2.0-beta versions. We are planning to release Mockito 2.0 soonTM. (lot's of delay due to IRL projects)
How's that going to work? Everything 2.0.x will rank lower in sorting than the already released betas, won't it?

issue.title: Default answers for Java 8 specific classes

repository.name: mockito-java8
repository.description: Mockito add-ons leveraging Java 8 and lambda expressions to make mocking even more compact

issue.body:
Additional `Answer` supporting smart default values Java 8 specific classes (like empty for `Optional`).

Could be used during a mock creation `mock(MyJava8Class.class, RETURNS_JAVA8_EMPTY_VALUES)` or just `mock8(MyJava8Class.class)`.

Unfortunately due to immutable specifics of enum - `Answers` cannot be extended from the 3rd-party library and it would **not be possible** to use it with `@Mock` annotation. As a workaround it could be used as a default answer for the whole project using `IMockitoConfiguration` mechanism. See my old [blog post](https://solidsoft.wordpress.com/2012/07/02/beyond-the-mockito-refcard-part-1-a-better-error-message-on-npe-with-globally-configured-smartnull/) for details.

Classes to consider:
- [ ] `Optional`
- [ ] `CompletableFuture`

issue.title: Add default answers for java.util.Optional{Double,Int,Long} and java.util.stream.{Double,Int,Long}Stream

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body: A natural generalization of #191 and #429 is to add default answers for the primitive `Optional` and `Stream` variants as well. I'm working on a PR proposal; will file soonish.

body: Is this still not merged in Mockito ? I‚Äôm currently using 2.8.9 and I still get null iso Optional.empty()

issue.title: Return Optional.empty instead of null for Optional return type

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body: Currently when using Mockito the default behavior is to return `null` for regular objects including `Optional` return types. Instead of returning `null` it would be better to return `Optional.empty()` in those cases.
